JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE and DATE , respectively , and live in ORG .
CARDINAL . The applicants are a married couple and their son .

CARDINAL . The applicants lived in a flat that in DATE became unsuitable for living owing to break - down of the sewage system . In DATE the first and second applicants , also acting on behalf of their then underage son , brought court proceedings seeking housing from ORG ( “ ORG ” ) . By judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG ( “ ORG ” ) acknowledged that the applicants ' flat was unsuitable for living and ordered ORG to provide them with a “ comfortable housing suitable for CARDINAL persons in compliance with the applicable legislation ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , acting on appeal , amended the judgment . It specified , in particular , that “ the flat should be in a brick building situated within the town centre ” . The appeal court also awarded each applicant MONEY ( RUB ) in non - pecuniary damage .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicants submitted a writ of execution to ORG . On DATE an authorised bailiff opened enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . Further to the applicants ' complaint , on DATE ORG declared unlawful the bailiff 's failure to enforce the judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the bailiff and officials of ORG inspected CARDINAL municipal flats and considered them eligible to be offered to the applicants . The latter however refused both flats .
CARDINAL . NORP By letter of CARDINAL DATE the bailiff informed the applicants that ORG had allocated funds for purchasing a flat for them .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the ORG offered to the applicants to buy a flat or , in the alternative , to pay compensation .

CARDINAL . In DATE the ORG made CARDINAL new offers . On DATE the applicants accepted resettlement into CARDINAL of those flats . On DATE they obtained an occupancy voucher and the enforcement proceedings were terminated .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants received keys to the flat . On DATE the flat was inspected by the housing committee and the applicants signed the inspection record .

CARDINAL . Thereafter , the applicants complained to various authorities that the judgment of DATE had not been properly enforced because repair works were still required . Those were carried out in DATE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicants brought a court action against ORG and ORG for the loss of profit and compensation for non - pecuniary damage incurred through the belated enforcement of the judgment of DATE . By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG of GPE dismissed their action . It found , in particular , that the flats offered to the applicants in DATE and DATE had met the requirements of the housing legislation . Therefore , their refusal to accept those offers had been ungrounded and the delays in the enforcement occurred afterwards could not be imputed to the bailiffs ' service . On DATE ORG upheld the said judgment on appeal .
